column4: Can anyone please tell me how to get my printer's official name so I can use it on a network in 7.10?
how is the printer being shared?  Direct network connection?

Directly through a home network. I want to share it to an XP laptop, and i'm looking at the wiki entry on printer sharing but the url I put in the Windows "Add a Printer" wizard is http://mypcname:631/printers/PRINTER_NAME and I don't know what that is. I've tried everything.
directly on the network?  i.e., attached to a router, or otherwise directly via ethernet?
Yes
well, that URL you gave was for a printer connected to a machine running cups, where the printer was connected to the machine, not the network directly
Allow me to clarify, maybe I misunderstood you. An Ubuntu 7.10 PC with a directly connected printer sharing to a Windows XP laptop on a network.
you've configured cups to share it?

I didn't know I had to. It doesn't say anything about that in the wiki. I have the printer working fine on this, the UBuntu desktop with the printer directly plugged in so I assumed sharing was simply a matter of connection.
yes, you have to explicitly enable sharing
Alright, how? Or can you link me to something that'll say how? *does wiki search while waiting*
System -> Administration -> Printing
I've seen that dialog and have the "Share printers connected to this system" check-marked.
then all you need to do is follow the steps for adding a network printer on the Windows side.

Ah, that's the problem and we're back to the beginning. What's the name of my printer so I can enter it into the network URL field in the Windows XP add printer wizard (Or rather, how do I find the name?)
it should auto-detect via the network
It does not.
try restarting cups, then: sudo invoke-rc.d cupsys restart, and then try again
beyond that, I can't help you much, as I don't use windows.
sudo invoke-rc.d cupsys restart
so, Windows can now see the printer after restarting cups?

It can see the computer, but will not let me see the printers on it. I think this has something to do with the laptop also not being able to get into the Ubuntu desktop for file sharing too, saying it's got permission problems. I am searching for a solution on my own to unlock this unless someone's willing to share...
